Uses of Class
fr.cnrs.iees.graph.Direction

  • Packages that use Direction 
    Package Description
    fr.cnrs.iees.graph
    The core interfaces of the omugi library: graph, node, edge, etc.
    fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl
    Three implementations of the fr.cnrs.iees.graph interfaces.

    • Uses of Direction in fr.cnrs.iees.graph

      Methods in fr.cnrs.iees.graph that return Direction 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Direction Direction.valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static Direction[] Direction.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in fr.cnrs.iees.graph with parameters of type Direction 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Edge Node.connectTo​(Direction direction, Node node)
      Connects this node to the node argument and return the resulting edge (will instantiate an edge), according to specified direction.
      default Edge Node.connectTo​(Direction direction, Node node, ReadOnlyPropertyList edgeProperties)
      Connects this node to the node argument and return the resulting edge (will instantiate an edge), according to specified direction, adding the property list to the edge (if compatible with the EdgeFactory used to instantiate the edge).
      void Node.connectTo​(Direction direction, java.util.Collection<? extends Node> nodes)
      Connects this node to a list of other nodes.
      int Node.degree​(Direction direction)
      The number of edges connected to this node (= degree) in the IN or OUT direction.
      void Connected.disconnectFrom​(Direction direction, Node node)
      Disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the node passed as argument.
      java.util.Collection<? extends Edge> Node.edges​(Direction direction)
      Read-only accessor to edges according to direction.
      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> Node.nodes​(Direction direction)
      Read-only accessor to the nodes connected to this node, following direction.
      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> Connected.traversal​(int distance, Direction direction)
      As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (node or edge) and stopping after distance recursion steps.
      default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> Connected.traversal​(Direction direction)
      As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (edge or node).
      default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> Node.traversal​(int distance, Direction direction)

      int SimpleTreeNode.degree​(Direction direction)  
      int TreeGraphNode.degree​(Direction direction)
      Takes into account the tree links in the computation of the degree, the parent link being counted with direction=IN and the child links being counted with direction=OUT

      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> SimpleTreeNode.nodes​(Direction direction)  
      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> TreeGraphNode.nodes​(Direction direction)
      Returns all nodes linked in a given direction, parent being counted with the IN nodes and children with the OUT nodes.
